no_posts: There are no posts to show
hash_mutemsg: Posts with a hashtag of “[NAME]” will now be muted.

mute_finish: You'll start seeing posts from [NAME] again
block_start: You won't see any more posts from [NAME]

spammer_error: There Was a Problem When Reporting This Account
draft_quest: Would you like to save this message as a draft?
disp_ts_notes: Customise How You See Post Times
disp_dd_notes: Enable Debug Mode and See More Information
color_title: Choose a Colour Scheme You Like
tools_title: What Would You Like to See?
proxy_label: Save Your Bandwidth, CPU, and Memory
network_label: Note: This table does not auto-update
srv_adn: You are connecting directly to the App.Net servers in America.
srv_nice: You are connecting to @matigo's Nice Proxy server in Osaka, Japan.
xproxy_line1: Using any of these functions means that you will be accessing your App.Net data through the Nice.Social API created by me (@matigo). I don't track your data, nor will I be keeping your ADN Access Token on my servers. The Nice.Social API is being used to ensure consistent information and to return more data with fewer API calls. This means you receive more information in less time with fewer inconsistencies.
xproxy_line2: If you do not want your App.Net credentials going through the Nice.Social API, then please do not use any of the 'tool' functions. Have any questions? Get in touch with me at @matigo.
yproxy_line1: Using the Nice.Social Proxy service means that any data you receive from App.Net will first go through the Nice.Social API. What this will do is allow the Nice server to do the heavy CPU work of determining if a post should be displayed or not, as well as ensure that all of the necessary account details (such as avatars and names) exist before the data reaches your browser. Any time you create a new post, that information will go directly to App.Net as there is nothing the Nice.Social API has to do to the data.
yproxy_line2: Your App.Net credentials are never stored on the Nice.Social API servers. I don't want to access your data, nor do I have any right to. This service is only to reduce the amount of bandwidth, CPU, and memory that Nice uses on your device, while also providing more complete information. Account names in the Private Messages column would be a good example of this.
yproxy_line3: If you do not want your App.Net access token going through my Nice.Social API servers, do not enable this feature.
yproxy_line4: Have any questions, comments, concerns, feedback? Get in touch with me at @matigo.
file_validate: Waiting for ADN to Validate File
err_invalid_audio: Your browser does not support the audio element.
err_one_fifteen: Whoops. Please enter a value between 1 and 15
err_geocase1: Uh oh. Nice Is Not Permitted to Access Your Location Data
err_geocase3: Very sorry. Nice Cannot Add Your Location. The Geolocation API Timed Out.
err_geosorry: Very sorry. The Geolocation API Is Not Supported By Your Browser
err_geodeflt: Whoops! Nice Cannot Determine Your Location
err_wcpline1:
There Was a Problem Sending Your Post to ADN.
Please let @matigo know if this problem persists more than a few minutes.
err_wcpline2: There Was a Problem Sending Your Post to ADN.
err_pmrline1: Uh oh. Looks like App.Net returned a 400-series error. Please try again.
err_pmrline2:
There was a problem reading some information from App.net.
Please let @matigo know if this problem persists more than a few minutes.
